articles.title: ‘Utter hypocrisy’: tobacco firm lobbied against rules in Africa that are law in UK
articles.description: British American Tobacco pushed Zambian ministers to drop or delay ad bans, health warnings and restrictions on flavoured products, letter showsBritish American Tobacco has been accused of “utter hypocrisy” for lobbying against tobacco control measures in Africa that are already in place in the UK.A

articles.title: Ten years after Paris terror attacks that killed 130 people, jihadist threat has evolved
articles.description: But ‘the ultimate strategic objective, for both Al-Qaida and Daesh (IS), has not changed: the establishment of a global caliphate’ of Islamist rule

articles.title: Edmonton Oilers scratch out a two-game win streak with consecutive OT winners: Cult of Hockey Player Grades
articles.description: The Edmonton Oilers were the better team over sixty-plus minutes but still had to squeak out a 2-1 Overtime victory Wednesday in Philadelphia. The Oilers dominated over forty minutes. The shots were 13-5 in the first, with no Philadelphia shots over the final eight. In fact, Edmonton had 14 in a row

articles.title: Kelowna’s unemployment rate jumps again, worse than height of COVID-19 pandemic
articles.description: According to Statistics Canada, the jobless rate in the Kelowna area rose to 9.3 per cent in October, an increase of 2.2 per cent in just one month – the 2nd highest in B.C.

articles.title: Roslovic comes up with second overtime goal in as many games for Edmonton Oilers
articles.description: One down, six more to go. The Edmonton Oilers opened a stretch of seven away games in 11 days with a 2-1 overtime win over the Philadelphia Flyers on Wednesday. The win starts Oilers’ longest road trip in 12 years, which wasn’t a good omen for a team that disembarked with a 2-5-2 record

articles.title: Alberta municipalities gather in Calgary, debate call for province to collect own property tax
articles.description: At the 2025 Alberta Municipalities Convention, a featured resolution calls on the province to collect its own education property tax, currently included on municipal tax bills.

articles.title: China’s AI is quietly making big inroads in Silicon Valley
articles.description: Chinese AI models are being adopted by US firms and winning praise from tech leaders in a challenge to Big Tech.

articles.title: Jamaica Association of Montreal collecting goods for communities hit by Hurricane Melissa
articles.description: The Jamaica Association of Montreal and its volunteers are unloading boxes filled with food, clothing, and essential supplies — all for communities in Jamaica devastated by Hurricane Melissa. “A lot of non-perishable items are there, a lot of sanitary products, a lot of dif

articles.title: Opinion: Quebec Liberals should take a page from U.S. Democrats
articles.description: Voters don't want to be told what to fear; they want something to believe in. That's the lesson from Mamdani and others.

articles.title: STM shutdown this weekend as bus and métro drivers cleared to strike
articles.description: No bus or métro service on Nov. 15 and 16

articles.title: U.S. House passes spending bill to end record federal government shutdown
articles.description: Seven Senate Democrats and one Democratic-aligned independent broke with the party to back the stopgap spending bill in exchange for a Senate vote on extending Obamacare subsidies

articles.title: Flint Firebirds get past London Knights in mid-week matchup
articles.description: The Flint Firebirds held on to edge the London Knights 3-2 on Nov. 12 at the Dort Financial Centre. Flint outshot London 36-28.

articles.title: Labour tribunal approves full STM strike this weekend
articles.description: Bus drivers and metro operators at the Société de transport de Montréal (STM) may go on strike this weekend. This decision was handed down on Wednesday night by the Administrative Labour Tribunal. From 4 a.m. on Nov. 15 to 3:59 a.m. on Nov. 17, STM services will be completely suspended, with the exc

articles.title: 60 years of NSR history looking for new home
articles.description: Richard Foster has 60 years of North Shore Rescue history in his home.

articles.title: Parachutist rescued from mountain near Squamish
articles.description: Man jumped from Slhanay Mountain and landed 60 feet below, injuring both ankles

articles.title: Could a corner store be your new neighbour?
articles.description: It’s an attractive idea: shaking up Toronto’s zoning laws so you can shop, eat and drink right where you live. It’s an idea that some residents grew up with, and they’d welcome its return. “There are many neighbourhoods where people would love to have a grocer where they can walk t

articles.title: House passes bill to end historic government shutdown, sending measure to Trump
articles.description: Republicans used their slight majority to get the bill over the finish line with a mostly party-line vote of 222-209. The Senate has already passed the measure.

articles.title: 87-year-old USask student graduates, seeks to keep Cree language alive
articles.description: Louise Fraser made history Wednesday as one of the oldest graduates from the University of Saskatchewan and she hopes to use her knowledge to keep the Cree language alive.

articles.title: City says transit fare enforcement efforts are paying off
articles.description: The city says its expanded efforts to crack down on fare evasion on transit buses are making a difference.

articles.title: Ksi Lisims LNG’s expected major project status puts spotlight on First Nations dispute
articles.description: Plan by Ksi Lisims to export LNG from Nisga’a territory is facing multiple legal challenges

articles.title: US knew Israeli officials discussed use of human shields in Gaza: Report
articles.description: Israel has repeatedly been accused of using Palestinians as human shields in violation of international law.

articles.title: Jack Dorsey funds diVine, a Vine reboot that includes Vine’s video archive
articles.description: Jack Dorsey backs diVine, a Vine reboot that includes Vine's video archive of six-second, looping videos. A new app called diVine will give access to more than 100,000 archived Vine videos, restored from an older backup that was created before Vine's shutdown.

articles.title: Calgary police officer faces additional charges of fraud, theft
articles.description: A Calgary police officer now faces a total of eight charges involving the alleged theft of thousands of dollars worth of items from hardware stores in the Calgary area.

articles.title: Legault’s popularity hits new low as CAQ faces mounting discontent
articles.description: A new Léger poll finds that 71 per cent of Quebecers are dissatisfied with Legault’s performance, while 61 per cent believe he should resign.

articles.title: B.C. hotel rates a ‘critical challenge’ ahead of FIFA event
articles.description: New data from CoStar shows that hotel room prices in Vancouver reached record highs this past summer, with the city's average daily rate climbing to nearly $330 in July.

articles.title: B.C. woman ‘terrified’ to be without MS drug but province doesn’t cover it
articles.description: Cassandra Nieman was prescribed the drug Ocrevus, which not only greatly improved her vision but also kept other symptoms at bay. But without coverage, it costs $20,000.

articles.title: Trump signs spending bill to end longest US gov’t shutdown in history
articles.description: The House of Representatives passed the much-delayed bill hours earlier.

articles.title: Police seek help in search for 40-year-old last seen in Montreal Road area
articles.description: Michael Harding, 40, frequents the Sandy Hill and Vanier areas, police said

articles.title: Heavy rain coming for parts of B.C.’s south coast: Environment Canada
articles.description: Pouring rain is on the way again for parts of British Columbia's southern coast.

articles.title: Huge public response over lack of detail in ABC Vancouver's 'back to basics' budget
articles.description: Vancouver residents repeatedly urged city council not to approve the 2026 operating budget without more detail and transparency

articles.title: Toronto City Council approves new snow clearing plan
articles.description: City Council has approved an updated snow removal plan with the hopes of avoiding last February’s debacle that left residents angry and frustrated.
